attributes.action: MPs should be paid the National Living Wage after regaining control of their pay
attributes.background: Many working people struggle financially on low wages. MPs are currently 'forced' to receive large salaries and pay increases by an independent body.  By reclaiming their right to set their own pay they could set it at the National Living Wage. This would encourage them to work for a fairer society.

attributes.action:
Petition Minister of Health -
Establish Hospice Suites in NHS Hospitals
attributes.background: The current Office of National Statistics survey of End of Life Care, ‘Voices’, shows 96% of the dying strongly prefer home care or some more private and congenial place to die than the wards of a Hospital. Only 3% prefer Hospital yet half of deaths annually in England will occur on the wards.
attributes.additional_details:
Hospice care is the ‘centre of excellence’ for palliative care but most of us will die on the wards. We could have privacy, dignity and specialised care in Hospice Suites requiring reorganisation rather than more resources to establish.  

A recent Select Committee hearing had an NHS spokesman claiming this provision would reduce the skills of generalist Nurses and Doctors,  as if patients exist only to provide practical experience for medical staff. The dying should enjoy the best we can provide.

attributes.action: Tougher consequences for Domestic Abuse including mental and financial abuse.
attributes.background: Domestic Abuse is looked upon as mostly solely physical abuse in society, and this needs to change. It needs to be made publicly aware that it's more than just physical, including mental and financial. This can impact a victims life as much as phsyical, and should hold a higher sentence for all.
attributes.additional_details: There should be higher consequences for all aspects of domestic abuse including an automatic 2 year restraining order for anyone found guilty of causing Domestic abuse. This will resolve further issues including harassment and stalking preventing further abuse. A domestic Abuse list should be created to protect victims who suffered the abuse. Mental and financial abuse should be thoroughly investigated having the same consequences as phsyical. These consequences should prevent abuse re-occuring

attributes.action: Make it illegal to set up camp on public or private land without permission
attributes.background: In Newport gypsies set up camp with 14 caravans and an array of luxury cars including two Mercedes, a BMW X6, and a Volkswagen, blocked hundreds of NHS staff from parking outside the hospital. Hospital spokesman Ms Hayman said legal advice was sought over how to eject them.
attributes.additional_details:
Can gypsies and travellers occupy any seemingly vacant land?
No, as mentioned above, they cannot simply occupy land because it is vacant, if it has not been designated for this purpose.
Gypsies or travellers should contact the local authority in the area in which they wish to camp to find out whether there is any space for them on a permanent, or temporary site.

attributes.action: Stop 39 week waiting period for mortgage interest payments
attributes.background:
From 1/04/16 the government has implemented a 39 week waiting period for mortgage interest payment support. 
This means that people like myself who have always worked and paid into the system but now can not work through no fault of their own such as cancer risk losing their property
attributes.additional_details:
From 1 April 2016 the waiting period until you receive any payment will increase from 13 to 39 weeks for new claims.Reference DWP website
Support for Mortgage Interest (SMI) https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest/overview

attributes.action: Increase drink driving ban from a minimum of 12 months to a minimum of 24 months
attributes.background: Drink drivers are a bigger threat than terrorists. Some people seem to love taking risks. The majority of the time it's not the drink driver that gets hurt. 3,000 people a year on average are either killed or injured by a drink driver. Take the drink drivers off our streets for longer.

attributes.action: Strip First Group as franchise holders of Great Western Railways
attributes.background: General contempt for passengers' needs and woeful strategy in times of difficulty. Relaxed attitude to cancellations and delays.  Timetable relaxation to suit GWR.
attributes.additional_details: Journey times from Wiltshire are broadly 20% longer and tickets broadly 80% dearer than just over a decade ago.  Car park costs doubled.  Cancellations and delays are frequent. Limited conpensation for season ticket holders and GWR are past masters at making it difficult to claim. General contempt for the people they are supposed to serve.

attributes.action: Support scrapping the 'lesser-duty' rule to save British steel industry.
attributes.background: The government are stating they are exploring all avenues to help the British steel industry. However, they continue to oppose the EU's attemps to remove the 'lesser-duty' rule which would impose higher levys on chinese steel. We ask that the goverenment helps British steel industry and save jobs.

attributes.action: Increase the number of physiotherapists in the NHS.
attributes.background:
Waiting times from a GP referral vary from 2 weeks to 3 months or more.
Prompter physiotherapy would:
1. Increase patient mobility, strength, coordination, confidence and well-being.
2. Prevent deterioration or accidents, thereby reducing treatment costs.
3. Reduce pressure on GPs and hospitals.

attributes.action: The Government should make contingency plans for an EU Referendum Leave vote.
attributes.background: H.M. Govt., like all responsible organisations, needs to look into the future and produce contingency plans for all potential outcomes which would significantly change the status quo, and which have a high probability of coming about. e.g.How will we get the best Trade Deal and Curtail Immigration?
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister has stated that, in the event of a Leave vote, he would want to stay in office to negotiate the best deal for Britain. It would be an abdication of his responsibilities for him to not start planning for this outcome now. There are many areas that need to be considered e.g. trade deals with non-EU countries, examination of EU rules and directives and their formal incorporation into UK law or abandonment, the recovery of our fisheries, UK subsidies to farming, etc.

attributes.action: Government to stop giving immigrants and refugees free ESOL and education.
attributes.background: Colleges and educational facilities to stop giving free education to refugees and immigrants funded by the government the educational funds should be given to uk citizens and non citizens should have to pay for their education. bursaries and grants and free courses only available to uk citizens
attributes.additional_details: The amount of money our government spends on education on immigrants and refugees is more then what is allocated to uk citizens. Refugees and immigrants if they can't speak English should pay fees for this education not taking tax payers money to fund this colleges and educational facilities are now over run with ESOL classes ran for free but this money should be allocated to help uk citizens only

attributes.action: The U.K. Military should under no circumstances engage in the defence of Turkey
attributes.background: Given the recent provocative attacks of Turkey in the Middle East and provocations against Russia from Turkey the UK should not deploy any of its military forces as part of a NATO defence of turkey should they be counter attacked by countries that Turkey is antagonising.

attributes.action: Do not allow MP's  to veto the democratic vote  to leave the European Union.
attributes.background: The people of the U.K. By a majority voted to leave the European Union on June 23rd 2016 but some MP's believe that it is their right to ignore the electorate who made this decision. Therefore we the undersigned call on the government not allow a vote on this decision.
attributes.additional_details: In refusing the opportunity for MP's to be given this vote it must remembered that Government gave a commitment to referendum which it stood by and the electorate with a turnout of more than 70% voted to leave the EU. Therefore Brexit must mean Brexit.

attributes.action: Benefits paid onto a government photo ID which limits what can be purchased.
attributes.background:
Sign this so that tax payers benefits are not spent on holidays, cigarettes, drugs, alcohol or sky TV etc.  
Benefits should not pay for luxuries or for people to go out socialisng and buying items working people consider luxury and difficult to afford.
attributes.additional_details:
People on benefits need support to live but they should not be able to spend this tax payers support on items working class people struggle to afford.  Shops would be limited in the items they can sell and prosecuted if they sell alcohol, cigarettes, lottery tickets, holidays etc. 
Pre-loaded cards should be in  the form of photo ID and a database to have the ability to store the bar codes of items purchased as a way for debt advisors to support budgeting if required.

attributes.action: Make a&e more equipped with private room& bathroom when dealing with miscarriage
attributes.background: Its the most horrific experience for a women and her partner to go throught and should be dealt with respectful no women should have to sit in a room full of people or have to clean herself up in a dirty bathroom that drunks go in in a&e

attributes.action: Tighter regulation on the resale of events tickets.
attributes.background: I tried to buy 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child'. It became clear that many of these tickets were going up onto other sites for hundreds and in some cases thousands of pounds more. Many of these tickets are failing to sell resulting in empty seats in the theatre on performance night.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose that more rigorous legislation is introduced to prevent these websites from being allowed to sell tickets for more than 10% of the face value. 

We cannot allow these websites to dictate the prices to see our favourite shows/bands/sports teams.

Why should these touts be the only people that benefit?

attributes.action: There needs to be a cull of seagulls in Britain
attributes.background: The seagull menace in Dundee and Angus has become to much for the residents to bear and we request a cull. We also believe this to be a nationwide problem and believe most coastal towns at least would support this cull.
attributes.additional_details: We are sick of the noise pollution, attacks, destruction, etc etc and call on this Government to act

attributes.action: Hold a Final EU Referendum
attributes.background:
A vote to Leave the EU on 23/6 was a false choice, for the terms of exit were unknown. Hold a Final EU Referendum giving electors a vote (transferable to second preference) from three clear choices:

• Leave with control of EU immigration
• Leave with EU single market access
• Remain in EU
attributes.additional_details:
The terms of a potential UK exit from the EU had not been addressed at the time of the 23 June 2016 referendum. Consequently, many who voted to Leave were not aware that the UK would have to choose between control of immigration from the EU and continued access to the EU single market. Leave voters are entitled to full disclosure of the necessary abandonment of one or the other of these core Leave aims. 

The electorate should be given the chance to express first and second  preferences from three choices: the two Leave alternatives and to Remain. Votes for the least favoured alternative would be transferred to second preferences.

This Final EU Referendum would provide the fairest and most democratic expression of public will to the government to guide its negotiations with the EU.

attributes.action: A General Election or another EU Referendum
attributes.background: Considering the very misleading campaign to leave the EU, the fallout we have witnessed since the now obviously flawed results and the fact that nobody in power seems to be acknowledging these issues, we the undersigned demand that the fixed term rules of Parliament be put aside and call an election
attributes.additional_details: If Parliament are not willing to allow a general election at this volatile and very confusing time, then at least pay attention to the facts surrounding the EU Referendum, that the results were largely due to flawed campaigns, lies and manipulations.  Many people, an estimated 7% according to one survey would vote differently 'now they know' the facts.  A referendum should not be actioned on results garnered through false information and scare tactics.  Election, or another referendum is needed.

attributes.action: Create a 'silent shopping hour' for autistic people in supermarket chains.
attributes.background: Autism Spectrum Condition is a developmental disorder that affects 700,000 people in the UK from birth. One type of autism is is over/under sensitivity to senses such as hearing, sight and smell. As a result, many autistic people find it very difficult to shop with lots of noise and flashing lights.
attributes.additional_details: An ASDA branch in Manchester ran a trial of a 'quiet hour' for autistic people, in which they turned off bright lights, loud music, and store announcements. This was very highly supported, and autistic people found it incredibly beneficial for them. We are a National Citizen Service group who have learned a lot about this topic recently, and we want more supermarket branches to create a 'silent hour', in order to make life that little bit easier for people with autism.

attributes.action: The Queen should be asked to stop Art 50 being invoked because of the referendum
attributes.background: In the light of the threat to the integrity of her United Kingdom and the narrowness of the vote, Members of Parliament should request that Her Majesty the Queen use the powers invested in her to ensure that Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty is not invoked on the basis of the June 23rd referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
The narrow victory for Leave in the recent referendum, and the likelihood that initiating Article 50 will lead to the break-up of the United Kingdom, leave the UK in a very difficult position. Political parties are in chaos. 
The Queen has the power to stabilise the United Kingdom and it would help if she were advised to do so by Parliament.

attributes.action: Compulsory educational visits to The battle of the Somme and Churchill's bunkers
attributes.background: I feel that children have very little knowledge about the sacrifices soldiers made for our country and why we should always take time to remember them as a mark of respect. It should become part of the curriculum for history and geography.

attributes.action: Hold a general election in 2017 under proportional representation
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, political and economic chaos has thrown the UK into uncertainty. An unelected prime minister will be appointed and turmoil in party politics shows politicians to have a lack of value in democracy. FPTP is a dated mechanism and is not representative of the people.

attributes.action: Urge the Governments in China, Vietnam & Asia to ban the Dog Meat Trade
attributes.background: I was physically sick when I saw a video on Facebook depicting the torturing to death of dogs for human consumption. The dogs are kept in horrific conditions & as sentient animals, feel the same emotions that we do. They are absolutely terrified. It is inhumane, barbaric & abhorrent & needs to stop
attributes.additional_details: The Yulin Dog Meat Festival & Asian Dog Meat Trade focuses on farming dogs for human consumption. Thousands of dogs are rammed into tiny cages, contorted & left to weaken. Dogs are happy animals & it is believed that their happiness & good health is passed onto those who eat them. The perpetrators think that torturing the dogs by blow torching & skinning them alive & battering their heads willl keep the meat tender. Videos & live Facebook appearances, notably by Ricky Gervais are ref points.

attributes.action: Make It A Legal Requirement To Scan All Cats For A Microchip
attributes.background: My Portia went missing 9 weeks ago and no one has handed her in. Someone must have taken her, thinking she was a stray. Maybe they don't know she's missing, but this is why I want this law in place. I am heartbroken and so are other owners who are missing their cats.
attributes.additional_details: Many cats are taken in, believed to be strays and are never taken to the vets to see if the animal has an owner first.

attributes.action: Make sanitary bins in male toilets compulsory for the transgender community.
attributes.background: I would like male toilets to have sanitation bins as the transgender community will be able to feel more comfortable and not have to use the female toilets if they are menstruating. This will promote self esteem among the transgender community.
attributes.additional_details: As gender neutral toilets are gradually coming into place, I believe it is very appropriate that the transgender community is made to feel as comfortable as they can be. The cost of the sanitation bins are very little and extremely convenient. The bins will be used if the trans* man is menstruating. He will then be able to use the male bathroom and feel comfortable doing so.

attributes.action: If Brexit happens. All previous EU spending should be forced to go to the NHS.
attributes.background: The Leave campaign made promises that the money spent in the EU would go to the NHS. They should be forced to up keep that promise.

attributes.action: No general election until after Brexit
attributes.background: We call on the next Tory leader not to call a general election and concentrate on brexit and make the divorce from the EU smooth as possible

attributes.action: Article 50 must be invoked within12 mths following the result of the referendum.
attributes.background: David Cameron has not invoked article 50. In order to stop this or a future government from not respecting the result of the referendum and the wishes of the people of the UK, there must be a rule that Article 50 must be invoked within 12 months of the result of the referendum.

attributes.action: All school meals in the UK to be planned and supervised by a nutritionist
attributes.background: Better nutrition for our kids needs to be a priority. Nutrition is the very foundation for a healthy life. Hungry kids tend not to pay attention during class, lack focus and affects their moods.
attributes.additional_details: Example, Finland one of the best education systems in the world, is nutrition part of their success? http://www.oph.fi/download/47657_school_meals_in_finland.pdf

attributes.action: Call a UK referendum on what our new relationship with Europe should be.
attributes.background:
A referendum is now required to clarify the position of the people of the UK with regards the pending  negotiation of the UK's future relationship with the EU. An outline proposal 
1: Tariff-based trade as non EEA member
2: EEA membership subject to EU rules
3: Full EU membership

attributes.action: Bring back capital punishment for peodophiles and child sex offenders
attributes.background: Make the future safer for kids.

attributes.action: Give all teenagers aged under 18 on 23.6.16 a vote in a supplemental referendum.
attributes.background: Allowing teenagers to vote in a supplementary EU referendum will be good for the future of Britain’s democracy, because whatever the final outcome they will have had the opportunity to participate in the decision. Their votes can be added to the June ballot and the result recalculated.

attributes.action: Offer British citizenship to Polish nationals resident in the UK on June 23 2016
attributes.background: The Polish people are longstanding & valued friends and allies of the UK, and we have deep ties which exceed and excel any EU links. We hereby petition the UK Government to extend an offer of automatic British Citizenship to all Polish nationals resident in the UK on June 23rd 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
We deeply regret the sense of insult felt by the Polish nation resulting from the referendum decision to leave the EU. We wish to repair our relationship. We wish to recognise the outstanding contribution to peace of the Free Polish Army, and to reassure the UK's widespread, well integrated, Polish-heritage communities, which in many cases pre-date the formation of the EU. 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/history/familyhistory/bloodlines/migration.shtml?entry=polish_free_forces&theme=migration

attributes.action: Nationally standardise the colours of commercial and domestic rubbish bins.
attributes.background: Each council area has a different colour scheme for rubbish and recycling bins. This often adds to confusion over what can be recycled, and recyclable waste is often thrown away, or recyclable materials are often put in the incorrect bins.
attributes.additional_details:
The colour scheme would become second nature to people's views towards waste disposal. The colour scheme could even extend to public litter bins on the streets.

Whilst this process could take some time, it could be implemented in a phased way, as and when bins are scheduled for routine replacement.

attributes.action: Europeans in the UK for more than 10 years should be given British citizenship.
attributes.background:
We need to demonstrate that leaving the EU will not develop xenophobic reteric in the country,which can not be controlled.
There are lots of Europeans who are keeping this country running, in the health services and caring professions who are scared they will be kicked out due to the result.

attributes.action: Lower the Income Requirement for Spouse/Family Visas to UK from non EU Countries
attributes.background: The current income requirement for British citizens to bring their non-EU spouses to the UK is £18,600. According to the BBC, 50% of British Citizens do not earn enough to meet the new requirements. Britons earning minimum wage should have the right to a family. by basic human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
The High Courts suggested £13,000 ,above National Minimum Wage.Which, is being appealed by the Home Office as too low. Members of the EU with non-EU spouses aren't subjected to the same requirement. British citizens should not be punished for who they want to marry. 
The HS, Theresa May, said 'these current laws openly discriminate against the poor'.
Propose lowering the income requirement so that citizens working full-time(40 hours)on a minimum wage salary can be with their Spouses.

attributes.action: Pass a law prohibiting or limiting referendums
attributes.background:
Parliament should pass a law either prohibiting referendums or requiring that the result that would change the status quo would need to achieve more than two-thirds of the votes cast to pass.

The current EU referendum demonstrates that too often they are - disruptive, divisive and distracting.
attributes.additional_details:
We live in a representative democracy. It is important that people have a say in their own government but it is equally important that we avoid a tyranny of the majority and that on particular issues voting proceeds on the basis of knowledge and understanding. Representative democracy, for all its flaws, achieves that goal better than any referendum can.

Meanwhile the referendum process distracts from other issues, falsely turns complex questions into binary choices and fosters division.

attributes.action: Give domiciliary carers car maintenance funds per year.
attributes.background: I am carer in the community and my wages just about cover fuel and bills. I love my job but many of us carers cant pay for the wear and tear, that the daily usage is damaging our cars, by using it for up to 12hrs a day.
attributes.additional_details: I have found no extra help of funding/loans to help me get my car fixed and risk loosing my job

attributes.action: Families should only receive benefits & tax credits for their first two children
attributes.background: Why should people be having extensive families if they cannot afford them? Why should the hard-working tax-payer have to fork out for this? Why is there not a barrier on the amount of money provided for each family?
attributes.additional_details: On 7th June on the ITV programme, This Morning a lady was speaking about her 12 children & the £40,000 of benefits that she receives each year, not only this, but her plans for her 13th child. This, alongside many other stories like this one are becoming more regular. Should it be that people having 12 children gain more money through benefits than someone working full-time? There should be a point this is restricted and the choice to have more children is at the families own expense.

attributes.action: Increased pay for nurses, support workers and doctors in the NHS of 20% minimum
attributes.background: Last summer I was admitted to an adolescent psychiatric ward. My admission went on to last eight months and I have made tremendous progress in ways that I couldn't have foreseen in those first few days and months but I couldn't have done it without the incredible support network off staff!
attributes.additional_details: Less than a year on,i'm in college and aim to be back in full time education in September. I also have a part time job and I'm now providing for myself at 16 years of age. I am amazed at how the staff always responded calmly to fellow patients regardless of how much we might have tested their patience. I am inspired by their ability to stay calm in stressful situations. I appreciate the long and hard hours they put in to ensure other people's well being for a ridiculous excuse of a salary.

attributes.action: Ban letting agents from charging letting fees to renters.
attributes.background: Renters are hit with high costs every time they move. It is time to bring an end to expensive letting fees which are already banned in Scotland and which allow letting agents to unfairly 'double charge' both the landlord and the tenant.

attributes.action: Let all serving forces personnel grow a full beard.
attributes.background: Using the same guidelines as the Royal Navy, allow all serving personnel for all UK forces to grow and maintain a beard.

attributes.action: Introduce a minimum speed limit of 100mph in the fast lane of the UK motorway.
attributes.background: Minimum speed limit of 100mph in the fast overtaking lane on UK motorways could cut down on accidents that result in serious injuries or even death.
attributes.additional_details:
Statistics show most accidents on the motorway occur in slow moving traffic.

By introducing a minimum speed limit of 100mph in the fast lane on UK motorways could cut down on accidents. This could save millions of pounds annually.

Enforcement: A speed camera that is programmed to catch out motorists driving below 100mph in the fast lane on UK motorways.

Punishment: 3 penalty points and a £100 fine or a short driving test to test their ability to see if they can drive safely at atleast 100mph in the fast lane.

attributes.action: Cap CSA payments at set weekly amount regardless of income.
attributes.background: CSA payments are currently worked out based on the ex partners income. If you're on benefits you pay £5 per week. If you're earning £36,000 per year it goes to over £100 per week for a child and continues going up with each pound earned. Cap the CSA payments to child benefit amounts!
attributes.additional_details: CSA payment calculator. Works out 15% of gross income for one child, 17% for 2 children and 19% for 3 or more children. On £36,000 per year for 3 children this is £567 per month. Leaving the payee with £1700 per month to live on. This is unfair on the payee.

attributes.action: Make schools provide more support for left handed children learning to write
attributes.background: Schools are equipped for right handed children. Items such as workbooks are not helpful. At such an important time in their development, not having specific support can knock their confidence. For example work books set out so that their writing hand is not covering the words they are copying.
attributes.additional_details: I have two left handed children and a left handed brother.  They struggle to use simple things because they live in a right handed world.

attributes.action: Give 100% tax relief on pensions when care home costs exceed the pension income.
attributes.background: My elderly mother-in-law has Alzheimers Dementia and lives in a care home. Total pension income is around £16K PA.  Total care home costs are £33K and rising.  Why is it necessary to pay several thousand pounds income tax which erodes the reserves faster and will lead to her needing government help?
attributes.additional_details: There was a plan to cap the care costs but that has now been scrapped.  In any case it was not a true and honest capping but a sneaky way to make political capital out of addressing care costs without actually spending any money.  It would have benefited only a tiny minority. To allow large corporates to pay paltry amounts of tax whilst levying income tax on pensions paid to paupers is morally and ethically wrong and we should address this totally unjust state of affairs.

attributes.action: Educate and enforce pornography awareness in schools
attributes.background: I believe adolescents need to be educated on how pornography can affect their emotional and physical state. Many young people are viewing it without knowledge or awareness of how it could be harming them or others.This generation have a right to know the dangers of porn addiction and abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
http://fightthenewdrug.org/

http://www.roadtograce.net/current-porn-statistics/

http://yourbrainonporn.com/physiological-and-psychological-effects-modern-day-pornography-2013

http://www.webroot.com/gb/en/home/resources/tips/digital-family-life/internet-pornography-by-the-numbers

attributes.action: Extra bank holiday for the Queen's birthday as we had an extra day in February.
attributes.background: As we had an extra day in February, I think we should get an extra bank holiday to help celebrate the Queens birthday on the 10th of June.

attributes.action: I want every Cancer Survivor to be given a Long Term comprehensive Care Package
attributes.background: Failure to manage Consequences of Cancer Treatment effectively, long term, compromises survival, quality of life, recovery and patient experience. In addition the economy is impacted, through people being unable to return to work or education.  Mental Health is not being addressed
attributes.additional_details: Statistics show 1 in 2 of us will get a Cancer diagnosis, and at least 500,000 people in the UK are facing poor health or disability after treatment for cancer – that’s 25% of people who have already had a cancer diagnosis. Commissioners discriminate because complex needs include co-morbidities which are not recognised by the Private Service Providers.   The National Health Service was created to ensure no one slipped through the net and received joined up Care from Cradle to Grave.
